abstract: Readers offer their comments on my column about new brain research showing that sugary foods, exercise and altruism can all constitute addictions reminiscent of a crack cocaine addiction.
snippet: Readers offer their comments on my column about new brain research showing that sugary foods, exercise and altruism can all constitute addictions reminiscent of a crack cocaine addiction.
lead_paragraph: We in the pundit world probably don't pay enough attention to science, and in Sunday's column I make a too-rare foray in that direction. I write about new research, based on brain scans, on addiction and happiness. One lesson is that sugary foods can constitute an addiction - but so can running, and also generosity. Read the column and post your thoughts!

headline.main: The Latest in ... Brain Research on Addiction
